definition: thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: The S&P 500 Index has dropped 38 percent during the same period.
sentences.chinese: 同期标准普尔500种股票指数下降了38%。

sentences.english: This approach ignored the stock index futures and the cash-poor risks.
sentences.chinese: 这种做法忽略了股票指数期货和现货间的基差风险。

sentences.english: Saudi Arabia's main stock-market index is down by more than 50% year to date.
sentences.chinese: 沙特主要股票指数今年以来已经下跌了50%以上。

pinyin: Shang4 zheng4 zong1 he2 zhi3 shu4

definition: Standard and Poor (share index)/abbr. for 標準普爾|标准普尔[Biao1 zhun3 Pu3 er3]
Hang Seng index (of Hong Kong stock market)
